New Records: Bowden Francis carried a no-hitter into the ninth inning, twice in one month, but was unable to complete it.
Key Match Events: Francisco Lindor hit a game-tying solo home run in the ninth inning, and the Mets went on to score six runs in the inning for a dramatic 6-2 comeback win.
Pre-Game Insights: Bowden Francis had a chance to throw a no-hitter against the New York Mets, a feat that would have made him the second-ever Blue Jays pitcher to achieve this.
Post-Match Reflections: Sean Manaea tipped his cap to Francis in the ninth inning, saying 'That was a crazy performance. I've got to give respect where respect is due.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The win keeps the Mets in playoff position, sitting a half-game up on the Atlanta Braves for the National League's third wild-card spot.
Others: Bowden Francis walked off to a standing ovation from the Toronto faithful after missing out on a no-hitter.
